com.skyisland.questmanager.player.skill

Class LogReducedSkill

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skyisland.questmanager.player.skill.Skill
      • com.skyisland.questmanager.player.skill.LogReducedSkill
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StagedIncreaseSkill, java.lang.Comparable<Skill>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConcentrationSkill, DexteritySkill, PatienceSkill, TacticsSkill

    public abstract class LogReducedSkill
extends Skill
implements StagedIncreaseSkill
    Same as a log Skill, except the xp gain is further decreased. The idea is that common skills that apply all over the place should level up less.
    See Also:
    Skill, perform(QuestPlayer, int, boolean)

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void perform(QuestPlayer participant, int actionLevel, boolean fail)
      Adds experience to the skill, standardized as the specified amount for performing an action of level actionLevel and either succeeding or failing, as determined by fail This implementation differs from the standard one in that xp gains generally decrease as the skill level increases.
      void performMajor(QuestPlayer participant, int actionLevel, boolean fail)
      Performs a large action of the skill, resulting in larger awarded xp.
      void performMinor(QuestPlayer participant, int actionLevel, boolean fail)
      Performs a small action of the skill, resulting in smaller awarded xp.

    • Method Detail

      • perform

        public void perform(QuestPlayer participant,
                    int actionLevel,
                    boolean fail)
        Adds experience to the skill, standardized as the specified amount for performing an action of level actionLevel and either succeeding or failing, as determined by fail This implementation differs from the standard one in that xp gains generally decrease as the skill level increases. Performing an action with action-level matching skill level at level one gives much more xp than doing the same at a high level.
        Overrides:
        perform in class Skill
        Parameters:
        actionLevel - The level of the action that was performed. Maybe cooking salmon is a lvl 30 task, for example
        fail - whether or not the action was failed. May or not award xp on failure, as determined by config
